intro: Gilia lutescens, commonly known as the yellow gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Gilia lutescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
